Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2013 02:35AM Tdickinson wrote: Antbigler, I am not taking Tamoxifen. Since they were not able to get all of the DCIS with the lumpectomy, and I have high grade, I decided on the mx. I chose bilateral because I have very dense breasts and have had a biopsy on the right side due to something showing on the MRI. It was benign but I don't want to worry all the time about getting it in the other side, plus, matching sides is important to me. Hoping that after this no other treatment will be necessary and worries should be minimal. I did have the BRCA test done, it was negative and I have no family history of breast cancer but every person on my dads side has had cancer of some type for the last two generations.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2013 12:12AM Tdickinson wrote: I am scheduled for a BMX with TE on 9/11. I am 43 years old and about to be a first time grandma in October. I was diagnosed in June, had a lumpectomy and SNB in July but did not get clear margins, nodes were clear though.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2013 07:00PM Tdickinson wrote: Antbigler are you doing a UMX or BMX? Your posts say one then the other. It's been very difficult for me to wrap my head around all of this. I doubt anyone out here thought it was easy or didn't second guess all their decisions. The only thing you can do is what is best for YOU. Everyone takes different paths and have different reasons for doing so, everyone's cancer is a little different and every one handles theirs different. Once you decide what you are going to do, don't look back and wonder...move on, enjoy life.
